item.name: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game
item.conditiontext: Also expansion set with 40 new cases to solve. Mint condition.
item.haspartslist: expansion set. 40 new cases. Mint condition.

item.name: Advanced Heroquest
item.comment: Pre-cursor to Descent, and almost as much fun.

item.name: Advanced Heroquest: Terror In The Dark
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
Age of Gods
item.comment: Yawn

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: Call me shallow, but I like the game more now that I've got the goodies expansion :)

item.name: Ambush!
item.comment: Too fiddly

item.name: Archipelago
item.comment:
Wonderfuly thought out game, with excellent scenario choices for short medium and long game options. Have got the solo deck expansion as well (despite it being overpriced for what it is)
Worker placement, exploration, colony management, semi co-op game.

item.name: Archipelago: Solo Expansion
item.comment:
OK, I've now played all the short and medium length solo scenarios and had a lot of fun.
A couple of rebellion losses, mostly third places and 4 second places, but not even a sniff of a first place, and then....
I just played the Admiral levendest scenario. It ends after 6 turns and if you manage to do the maximum 3 successful explore actions every turn, and if you manage not to use ANY of your explore tokens to fend off crisies you can get a maximum of 18 explore tokens by game end. However 1st place requires you to get MORE than 18 explore tokens.... hmmmmmmm !!
Getting extra action counter(s) doesn't help cos you can't do more than 3 explore actions per turn.
I managed to get 13 explore tokens (quite an achievement I felt) and not to use any for crisies (and you need an element of luck in the early game to achieve that cos you start with zero settlers and it is possible that a 3 cube port crisis can turn up at the start of turn 2... a 2 cube crisis could be enough to end the game too or at the very least burn your precious explore tokens cos you're not going to get much atall into the export markets on turn 1 or have many cubes in stock). It's not like you can even plan to get the cubes in stock to cover it because you HAVE to buy an advancement card at the end of turn 1 so the port crisis will change just before it comes into force and you won't be able to discard any other achievements to alter it.
I'm not sure sufficient thought has been put into the victory levels, especially the 1st place ones......
Also, many of the scenarios are just variations on a theme. This expansion feels like it was thrown together in an afternoon. However I think the base game is wonderful.

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: Hmmm, it's a nice game and fairly quick to play. However, it feels more like a filler than a full blooded game. Theme is pasted on and that's a big minus for me. Wouldn't turn down a game, but wouldn't suggest it either. Another SDJ candidate.
item.conditiontext: German version with English rules. Completely language independent.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: The most thematically-rich game I've ever played. Plays superbly solo which is a MASSIVE bonus. What a great game !!

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: Fun back in the day, but not now.

item.name: Axis & Allies Miniatures
item.comment: Have got loads of map sheets for a monster layout (about 30). Loads of tanks and self propelled guns for a massive tank battle. :)

item.name: Axis & Allies: D-Day
item.comment: Yawn

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: Solid, but nothing special.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: For some time, this was my only 10 rating. Still love it to death and have painted all the miniatures.

item.name: BattleLore: Call to Arms
item.comment: Must-have.

item.name: BattleLore: The Hundred Years' War – Crossbows & Polearms
item.comment: Must-have

item.name: Beowulf: The Legend
item.comment: I like this game. Nice card interaction.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: Beautiful quality and nice game. Just wish I could get to play it.
item.haspartslist: Earth Spirit PROMO card for trade

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment: I like this game.

item.name: Box of Golf: A Classic Golf Board Game
item.comment:
I've had several golf games over the years, and this is definitely the best.
Don't think you're going to get deep gameplay here, but there is a STRONG element of push your luck, and the gems provide 4 types of bonuses. But, the winner is the player with the most gems at the end of the game, so be careful how and when you use them.
I have got the ENHANCED version, which is the mid-price option (and probably the best value for money).
It is larger than the basic option, and has 4 superb painted resin playing pieces. The deluxe version is made from cherry wood and has pewter playing pieces.
The game looks GORGEOUS and this is one I won't be trading.
For my full review go to:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/440875

item.name: Brass
item.comment: Terrific game. Must get it.

item.name: Bushido: Der Weg des Kriegers
item.comment: Suffers a bit in the endgame, as no-one would sensibly win a battle as Samurai that would give a game victory to the current Daimyo.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Tile placement yawn. Just not my cup of tea.

item.name: A Castle for All Seasons: Winter Cards
item.comment: English text set. Nice addition to vary the Winter map.

item.name: Catan
item.comment: Just Waaaaaaaaaay too much luck involved.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: Fun, but overrated IMHO.
item.conditiontext: German edition, called Machiavelli. Mint condition.

item.name: Civilization
item.comment: Excellent game, but very long.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.haspartslist:
2 Full colour additional content books. Professionally printed. Lots of extra scenarios.
Pics on this link: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/651520/additional-content-books-now-available-for-purchas

item.name: Combat Commander: Europe
item.comment:
OK, I have to eat some humble pie here. The talk of random events put me off getting this game for quite a while. To give credit where it's due though, they add colour to the game without making it FEEL random, and they aren't game-breakers.
Although my personal taste will always be for Grand Strategic games rather than squad-level, this game will definitely be a keeper for me. It is driven by multi-use card play (my favourite game mechanic), and to me this game is INFINITELY better than Conflict of Heroes (which I have traded)
The game index is AWESOME, and I didn't find the learning curve at all steep. Highly recommended.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment: Top game. I only traded it because Battlelore and Memoir '44 were getting far more use.
item.conditiontext: English version. Mint condtition. Pieces bagged.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Nice trick taking game with pasted on theme.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! – Russia 1941-42
item.comment:
Hmmm, this one is a conundrum to me. I REALLY want to like it more than I do. maybe that will come in time. The component quality is first class, but I have become so enamored with card-driven games such as Paths of Glory, that this just pales by comparison.
It also has to be said that I prefer strategic level games to squad level.
I would never turn down a game, but it doesn't have that must-play element for me.
It's no good, I had to give it up, cos the game was just SO dry and did not give me the richly thematic experience I demand from a game. I have traded it for Fields of Fire.

item.name: Container
item.comment: Not my cup of tea

item.name: Cruel Necessity
item.comment:
See, I have a problem with most made-for-solo wargames. They tend to be mechanised and abstracted to the point where the theme is destroyed for me by fidliness and disjointed game play.
However, this game is a happy exception. The event cards drive the game phase that is not under your control, and they enhance rather than destroy the theme for me.
Only one play so far but I think this game is going to be a keeper.

item.name: D-Day at Omaha Beach
item.comment:
Procedural, mechanical and ponderous.
I'm happy to accept that this is an excellent and innovative game, but it's not a game that suits my preferences. I prefer games like Paths of Glory that feel more like a game and less clockwork.

item.name: Darkest Night: With an Inner Light
Delve the Card Game
item.comment:
Perfect solo travel game.
No skill required but a lot more fun than reading the in-flight travel magazine :)
Perfect for kids to take to school too.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment:
I am wearing my blown-away face. The figures can hardly be called miniatures cos the monsters are Freakin MASSIVE. Gameplay is well thought out and atmospheric. I can't wait to get Road to Legend to enable proper campaign play, but wow !
Now to plan the painting of heroes and monsters, I've had a break since I did all my Battlore ones :)
Only one small gripe, I wish they's put as much effort into the hero minis as they did the monsters.

item.name: Descent: The Road to Legend
item.comment: must-have expansion

item.name: Diamant
item.comment: Incan Gold

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: You need to ignore the fact that this is a Martin Wallace game because it is both humorous and chaotic. If you don't like games that finish unexpectedly or with a liberal dose of luck, you best look elsewhere. If you like the books you'll love the game... it hasn't been cobbled together as a tie-in as so many other games have tried to cash in on branding. The humour and in-jokes are all there as are the characters. But it's a try before you buy if you haven't read the books.
item.wishlistcomment: Lite but chaotic fun... NOT standard Martin Wallace fayre

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Fun area control game. A bit too light for my taste.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: I think I prefer Thunderstone purely on the basis of theme. A bit too much deck-shuffling for my personal taste.

item.name: Dragon Dice
item.conditiontext: Battle Box plus a couple of expansions. Moderately big box. Includes 2 sealed packs of firewalker expansions. In total 52 dice of various shapes and sizes. They are gorgeously marbled. Fantastic quality. Also largish game board, rules, summary cards etc.

item.name: Duel of Ages Set 3: Vast Horizons
Duel of Ages Set 6: Field of Honor
Duel of Ages Set 7: Ruins of Cany XII
Duel of Ages: Scrye Add-On Pack
Dungeon Lords
item.comment: A minor disappointment. Not as fun as I though it was going to be. Shan't be buying it now, despite winning my first game of it as a first timer.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.conditiontext: Mint condition. Great game, must be something I really want to trade.

item.name: Dungeon Twister: Paladins & Dragons
item.conditiontext: Mint condition. Great game, must be something I really want to trade.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
Dust
item.comment: A Big improvement on Risk, with some nice little wrinkles. The two different manuals for supposedly different Games are almost identical and the few differences should really have been included as a few optional rules at the end. A bit of a phoney claim really. However, a good enjoyable game and quick to learn or teach.

item.name: EVE: Conquests
item.comment:
I like this game, but to see my suggestions to enhance and speed gameplay, go to:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/463229

item.name: Exalted: Legacy of the Unconquered Sun
item.comment:
I have done an in-depth review of this game here:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/396053

item.name: Fagin's Gang
item.comment: Good abstract game, but I don't like abstaracts.

item.name: Fantastiqa
item.comment: Rucksack edition

item.name: Field Commander: Rommel
item.comment: A much appreciated Christmas present from Alan & Charlie Paull.

item.name: Fields of Fire
item.comment:
To me, who doesn't normally like squad based games or micro-management, the learning curve for this game was very steep, and I HATE the manual.
BUT, I'M happy I persevered with this game, because it really is excellent if you hang in there. The best solo wargame I have ever played.

item.name: Forge War
item.comment: Very fun game. Has been compared to Lords of Waterdeep by some, but LOWD is 'meh' to me. This is another barrel of monkeys. Had great fun playing the solo variant and am now looking forward to competitive play.

item.name: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
Grand Tribunal
item.comment: The game is not broken, as some people think. There are 2 important errata on the game website. 1. You do NOT get 12 more viz tokens at the end of the first and second tribunals. 2. It costs opponents 2 viz (not 1) to buy into your gathering viz action. It is printed correctly on the BOARD.

item.name: Gumball Rally
item.comment: Fun, but a bit on the lite side for me.

item.name: Heads of State
item.comment:
This game is a conundrum. The board and components are excellent quality and the rules are well written. But it just isn't a deep enough game to demand a £50+ price tag.
HOWEVER, I paid £16.89 including shipping for a new copy and that was definitely a bargain.
It's a fun game, lasts 90-120 minutes and is a combination of set-making and worker placement. The scoring system is quite good. I think with 4 or 5 experienced players you could get a bit more depth out of it, but not from occasional playings.
At full price I would rate it a 5, but at the price I paid it's a solid 7 as it is more than the filler game level it was priced at.

item.name: Heroes of Normandie
item.comment:
Really glad I backed the Kickstarter for this, even though it took 13 months to arrive from payment and even though I am not a fan of Kickstarter. Fast and intuitive game system with fantastic quality components. Lots of small typos and misprints on counters, but that is hopefully being corrected and replaced. Probably too light for hardcore wargamers, but a very good crossover game.
Highly recommended

item.name: HeroQuest: Return of the Witch Lord
item.conditiontext: Mint condition. Figures still on their sprues.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
History of the World
item.comment: Gibson Games version
item.conditiontext: Gibson Games version. Split corner of box lid.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
Industria
item.comment: German version

item.name: Kemet
item.comment:
Deceptively easy to play once you have got the rules down. The quantity of upgrade tiles looks overwhelming at first, but they make sense very quickly.
The relatively easy action options make the game flow quickly, even with 5 players (which we had).
I think a second 5 player game could easily finished in 2 hours.
An enjoyable and fulfilling thematic experience.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: For my two pence, this is the most fun Euro-style game that you ccan play in an hour. Works equally well from 2-5 players. It also has the best use of dice that I have come across in a game. The expansion adds lots of extra fun options, and I particularly like the soldier tokens for extra strategy. I would recommend this game for any occasion and it is the best gateway game IMHO for non-gamers, even better than TTR.

item.name: kuuduk
item.comment: New

item.name: Last Will
item.comment:
I enjoyed this one a lot. Despite a lot of Will power, I finished Last in both games
But winning is irrelevant to my enjoyment of a game and it is a game I shall look forward to playing again and again. A relative has left a small fortune to the player who can LOSE all of their money the quickest. Obviously the idea comes from the film Brewsters Millions. Lite fun, but requires a reasonable amount of strategy in this worker placement game. Reasonably convincing theme.

item.name: Lord of the Rings
item.haspartslist:
3 Gandalf cards 3 Ally cards 3 Item cards
All from the Battlefields expansion
Available in German or French only
For sale or swap.

item.name: The Lord of the Rings Dice Building Game
Lord of the Rings: Battlefields
item.haspartslist:
3 Gandalf cards 3 Ally cards 3 Item cards
All from the Battlefields expansion
Available in German or French only
For sale or swap.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment:
The most fun game to play solo I have ever played.
Played loads of solo games
If you like RPG boardgames, this is the best IMHO
I am really enjoying playing 3p and 4p using Vassal.
This designer is a genius cos he has designed my 2 favourite non-wargames.... this and Through the Ages.
Worthy of an 11

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game: Krang Character Expansion
Mage Knight Board Game: The Lost Legion
Manifest Destiny
item.comment: Wow, this game is a real gem and deserves some love. Players of Paths of Glory will feel at home as it is like a lighter commerce version of that, and 3-5 players opens it up to a wider audience. Strongly recommend that you play through the example first 2 turns to pick up the flow of the game. This is a welcome resource and should be used by more games. Highly recommended.

item.name: Mare Nostrum
item.conditiontext: German version with English rules. Mint condition. Superb quality components.

item.name: Medieval Manor
item.comment: Had the cards printed properly by artscow....NICE !

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: Wonderful game, especially in Overlord format. Own 2 sets for that reason.

item.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Book Volume 1
item.comment: This is an absolute MUST have if you like M44. However, don't get it until you have gotten good service from the other expansions first or you will not get the best value out of the system. This should be the icing on the cake, not the entree.

item.name: Memoir '44: D-Day Landings
item.comment: Absolutely fanyastic. It's the only Breakthrough format that I like as much as Overlord format. The theme and special units and victory conditions make this a must play. Have so far played a 3 map game at a convention and played the Sword beach single map today. Gave up playing vanilla M44 years ago, but Overlord format and D-Day format are superb.

item.name: Memoir '44: Hedgerow Hell
item.comment:
A must-have for any M44 fan. Much more engrossing than the base game. My first session report:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/422812

item.name: Memoir '44: Operation Overlord
item.comment: Vitually the only way I play M44 these days

item.name: Merkator
item.comment: Good mechanics, but it's an abstract with a pasted-on theme to me.

item.name: Might & Magic Heroes
item.comment: An interesting game based on one of my favourite computer games. I'm a sucker for character development games. It doesn't surpass Mage Knight the boardgame, but what does?

item.name: Netrunner
item.conditiontext: Excellent game system. I have a large collection with rules. mint condition cards.

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment:
Poor component and board quality by todays standards for a product at this price point.
Complex unit interaction creates endless analysis paralysis and that kills it stone dead for me.

item.name: The New Science
item.comment: What a great theme for a game. As a theme junkie I can eat this up with a spoon. Only a small rulebook to digest and not overly complex, but tough decisions to be made and very fun.

item.name: NFL Strategy
item.comment: Mine is the deluxe cased set with handle.

item.name: Ogre
item.comment: KS edition, HUGE box

item.name: Panzer General: Allied Assault
item.comment:
Only played solo scenarios so far, but first impressions are very positive..
Setup time is lengthy with customising unit and action decks and placing terrain tiles etc, but the game repays this.
I think this game is going to be a keeper :)

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: A LOT of fun initially, Plays superbly solo with 2 characters. I've always been a sucker for games with character progression and this is great. Not cheap by the time you buy the 6 add on packs to complete the adventure path. But divide it by the amount of playtime plus it's superior solo playability (second only to Mage Knight the boardgame for me) and I can justify it to myself. I would question the expense to anyone who is only 'meh' about RPG's though. The repetitive nature of play soon killed the game for me though.

item.name: Paths of Glory
item.comment:
There is literally NOTHING about this game that I don't like.
OK, well yes, they really should include a mounted game board at the price, but I'm used to using plexiglas now, and would still do so anyway to protect it :)
I would give this game an 11 if I could :)
Have played over 40 full games, mostly on Vassal pbem. (not included in logged game plays)

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
Pirate's Cove
item.conditiontext: This is the German edition, Piraten Bucht. Mint condition.

item.name: The Price of Freedom: The American Civil War 1861-1865
The Prince: The Struggle of House Borgia
Puerto Rico
item.comment: I just don't understand all the hype over this game. It has zero WOW factor.

item.name: Quartermaster General
item.comment:
First playing of this game, and I have to say it was WAY above my expectations. Having read the rules a couple of times I thought it would probably be a seven, but I'm going to start it off as a nine and see how it goes from there.
I love assymetric games because they provide very different gaming experiences depending on which side you play. But even aside from that, I can see lots of potential replayability depending how the cards come out.
The Axis powers went to such an early lead that I though that the allies could never catch up and possibly that the game was unbalanced. Wrong and Wrong. The allies caught up for a last gasp win on the final turn (20).
Can't wait to play this game again and can't recommend it highly enough to players of similar tastes to my own. Bear in mind this is a strategic game of supply, warfare is very simple and not the focus of the game. I love wargames too, but this isn't really a wargame, it's a lite game with a war theme. Though the first playing still took 3 hours, so it's only the gameplay that is lite.
thumbsup Superb quality board and components.
thumbsup Assymetric game play with plenty of replayability.
thumbsup Easy to learn and play. Quite a small manual.
thumbsup Very interesting strategic decisions without being a brain burner.
thumbsup 6 nations each with their own unique card deck, and separate quantity of armies, navies and cards.
thumbsdown None that I can think of.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Red November
item.comment: A bit too lite for my tastes.

item.name: The Republic of Rome
item.comment:
I think I am in love :)
More theme and atmosphere than a pile of meerkats in a tumble dryer with smoking jackets and monocles :)
Learn this game from the streamlined rulebook available as a download from the files section.
Definitely not a game to just break out and try to play, but WELL worth the time invested in learning the rules.
Get the Valley Games reprint rather than the AH original cos the production values are sooooo much higher.

item.name: Return of the Heroes
item.comment: Good RPG boardgame that plays very well solo. You need quite a big table to lay everything out. On balance I just about prefer it to Runebound cos it feels like more of an 'experience' to play, and that always gets extra marks from me. Rules are not well written so definitely read them twice and get the FAQ.

item.name: Rise of Empires
item.comment: All games should aspire to this as a standard of component quality.

item.name: Risk
item.conditiontext: Parker brothers edition with 300 miniatures. Played once. 2 of the 6 sets of armies are still on their sprues.

item.name: Risk: The Lord of the Rings
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: A ggod quick fun game. Lovely components and Kudos for supplying a LARGE pad of score sheets.

item.name: Runebound (First Edition)
item.comment: Nice enjoyable RPG boardgame. On balance I just about prefer Return of the Heroes to Runebound because it has more of an 'experience' fell to it. But I recommend both of them highly.

item.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
item.comment:
The new version as pictured, not the 1981 original.
Have been meaning to get this to the table for months, but wanted to be able to do it justice as I've been relishing it.
OK, I played the first of the ten cases... The Munitions Magnate.
I don't want to spoil the case for anyone because there is unlikely to be any replayability in the cases, but you know that when you buy it.
Woohoo... I correctly deduced the perpetrator and the motive, but didn't get all the nuances of the case, so I scored 85 out of the possible 140 points.
Sadly I then had to deduct 5 points for every non-'free' lead I followed in excess of Sherlock.
It was my first case and I was trying to be meticulous and followed 15 scorable leads compared to Sherlock's miserly 4 !
That meant I had to deduct 55 points, leaving a final total of only 30.
But still a moral victory :D
:thumbsup: Uber thematic
:thumbsup: Beautifully produced. High quality documents and love the Newspaper sheets for each case.
:thumbsdown: No real replayability, but well worth the purchase price for 10 great cases to solve.

item.name: Shifting Sands
item.comment: Surprisingly good CDG given the confines of the operational zone available.

item.name: Shipyard
item.comment:
Best new game I have played for a long time. Knocks games like Dungeon Lords and Dominion into a cocked hat as far as I'm concerned.
Fabulous thematic game with excellent components, and nice varied game mechanics.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Surf's Up, Dude!
item.comment: Lite game with pasted on theme. Nothing to hold the attention. AVOID.

item.name: T.I.M.E Stories
item.comment:
Very good narrative based co-op game in the genre of the Quantum Leap TV show.
The game play is not deep and there is minimal replayability, but it is way more engaging than Tales of the Arabian nights IMHO.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: Just not enough game in it for me and the theme, whilst interesting, doesn't carry it enough to want more plays.

item.name: Tank Commander: The Eastern Front Edition
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
item.comment:
WOW, I thought I was going to enjoy this and I wasn't wrong :)
6 hours for a 3 player game with 2 first-timers, but it was time well spent.
MY only regret is that it's a game that would be difficult to play as often as I'd like due to complexity and timespan.
Small complaint that most of the wooden markers are SO tiny that they are extremely fiddly and often end up on the floor, at which point they can be hard to find again.

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment:
Hmmm... MUCH better than Dominion... but then I don't like Dominion.
This one is going to require more plays before I decide if I like it or not. Initial reaction is neutral.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.conditiontext: German edition with English rules. language independent game.

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment:
Love it, love it, love it.
Wish I could get it to the table more often.
Set-up time can be half an hour.
Annoying that the infantry don't go in and out of the bases easily and securely.
Will never sell or trade it.

item.name: Tide of Iron: Days of the Fox
Tide of Iron: Designer Series Vol. 1
Time of Soccer
item.comment:
The English translation of the rulebook is truly apalling, but if you watch a video walkthrough of the game, all becomes clear and the rulebook can then be decyphered.
And it is worth it, because this really is an excellent game, second only to The World Cup game in the football genre IMHO.

item.name: Timestreams: Deck 1 – Stone Age vs. Future Tech
Timestreams: Deck 2 – Medieval vs. Modern Day
Tomb
item.comment: Don't be put off at least TRYING this game by some of the negative comments it attracts. The rules are not as bad as some people make out, and I find it an enjoyable light romp, when Descent is too long for the time available.

item.name: Traders of Osaka
item.comment:
Have just upgraded my rating from 7 to 8.
You can EASILY play 2 games of this in an hour...3 games once your experienced. High quality components and the game packs far more punch than the filler price category it's in. Highly recommended and could easily become adictive.

item.name: Trajan
item.comment: Awful hodgepodge of euro and mancala mechanics with a pasted on theme. Truly dreadful.

item.name: Tycoon
item.comment: Mint

item.name: Under the Shadow of the Dragon
Up Front
item.comment: Excellent game, even for an ASL-hater like me :)

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment: Very strongly themed game, and I like the mechanics.... corruption, hidden movement etc. Not quite a 9 because I found myself constantly referring to the rules, and I found the text on the cards small and fiddly. A lot of scratchy head time. However it may still go to a 9 upon further plays, and should speed up considerably.

item.name: Warrior Knights: Crown and Glory
item.comment: Never play the base game without it.

item.name: Wars of the Roses: Lancaster vs. York
The World Cup Game: Expansion Set 1
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – Shadow of War
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – The Burning Crusade
World War II: Barbarossa 1941 – Battle for the Danube Expansion
World War II: Barbarossa to Berlin
Wrott & Swindlers
item.comment: I think only 200 sets were evr made. Beautiful quality.
